page.title: 20Pipewell Manor
page.content: Pipewell Manor is a very large house built in large, landscaped gardens. The main part of the house was probably built in the 16th century. Two wings were later added in 1864 and 1949. Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd live there alone now. The manor has about 11 chimneys, and there are lots of statues in the garden as well. Under the trees there are dogs' graves. There is also a private swimming pool and an old tennis court. The Manor has patterned windows, and wisteria and roses grow up the front. The Manor has some old stables. At the front there is a stone porch. Until 4 years ago beagles were bred at the Manor. Now Mr. Lloyd makes guns to sell. Part of the old house is being renovated for people to live there.
